name: shmuckeles
text: i wanted to enjoy this movie as a kid but i couldn't watch past this scene. i just couldn't figure that a guy would do something so nasty

name: straw
text: I think that since my mom was so anti-that scene made it easier for me to get past it.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: You're right. It was mega-nasty. It was dogshit.

name: gitarooman
text: I believe this is one of the best examples of how arbitrarily quoting old strips is just fucking stupid most of the time.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: cunt

name: theunity
text: Was a sock really the best thing they could find to represent the ding dang worm?

name: kledermans
text: I don't think you could find anything that represents a ding dang worm better than a sock.

name: greenkoolayd
text: nobody has a tacklebox with a rubber worm they could borrow?

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by instantkarma, Bex, ravindra108, aparrish)

name: gussiejives
text: The worm went in Chekov's ear.  And Paul Winfield's.

name: griffypoo
text: It's a pretty gross scene.  I don't think I'd want to emulate it any more truly, either.

name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, Jesler729, SSDDR, mercuri0us, jezebel, dropkickpikachu, CloseFriend)

name: i_love_kate
text: OMG HOW CUN U SEY THT STONDAD CUD B IMPROVD UP ON

name: alejandroadam
text: this is a 5 baby. he closes his eyes and gets a ding dong worm in his dang old ear

name: epicurus
text: Panel 3 for the goal. Those are in my top six last words.

name: teknofatcat
text: KHAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAN!!!

name: fermatprime
text: the reason I like this strip is that onstad is classy enough NOT to use that line.

name: mortshire
text:
just imagining teodor sporting khan's fake pecs.

oh DAAAAANG IIIIIIIIIIIITTT

name: tekende
text: He'd have fun little pecs!

name: gussiejives
text: And the guns.  Although Teodor would be hard-pressed to pick up Beef one-handed like Khan could do to Chekov.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: All Salma Hayek goin' "Niiiiccee Pecs!"

name: lolsworth
text: Those were real pecs, my friend. Even at 62, Ricardo Montalban was a ripped motherfucker.

name: centipede_damascus
text: A comment left by centipede_damascus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Connellingus, shoinan, deovalente)

name: never_die
text: if we had audio of this, those last 2 panels would be So awkward sounding.

name: patkun
text: He's clearly not comfortable in the role.

name: stuart
text: 2 lines of dialogue and this is Hamlet.

name: pitseleh
text: Alt text: "Dang, the worm is hell of killing his brain."

name: kledermans
text: I love how Beef has to lean in for Téodor to reach his ear with the sock.

name: denise
text: panel 4, his face is just so perfect. he is leaning forward to recieve it.

name: the_prophet
text: This one gets a 5 because Onstad resisted the insanely overused scene of Shatner screaming "Khan!" A funny quote, to be sure, but too often seen

name: gussiejives
text: "Buried alive... buried alive...."

name: catgrl131
text: Ah, ah, ah, ah, buried aliiiiiii-iii-iii-iiive!

name: fermatprime
text: ah, goddamnit. I said essentially the same thing above, then scrolled down to read this. ah well, bring the lames.

name: nucleargeranium
text: that ding dang worm hella killed him!

name: mindbnder
text: The Roomba!s are so superfluous to the execution of this scene.  They are not necessary.

name: quinlaenar
text: That's what makes it awesome.

name: jezebel
text: Much like Geometry.

name: charchar
text:
I can picture the set-up for this one
BEEF: (anticipating struggle w/ Teodor) Dibs on being Kirk
TEODOR: Sure
BEEF: (shocked T. did not put up more of a fight.) Ooooooohhhhh Shhhiiiiiittttttt.

name: straw
text: Once again, the worm (a "ceti eel"), is put in Chekov's and Dave Winfield's ears, not Kirk's.

name: gussiejives
text: Paul Winfield.  Although there should be more baseball players in sci-fi movies.

name: charchar
text: I stand corrected and uncertain as to what the hell I was thinking on that.  I have shamed those who love me.

name: woodenteeth
text: Fortunately I do not love you... but then, I do not know you.

name: gussiejives
text: It's a shame Teodor didn't spring for Ricardo Montalban's fake pecs on this one.

name: fattypneumonia
text:
Ricardo didn't fake them pecs. He had hella workout regimen for that movie.

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0084726/faq#.2.1.1

I also vaguely remember Montalban's autobiog mentioning that the pecs were real, too.

name: em2
text: The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few. I am, and always have been your friend.

name: crankheart
text:
of all the souls i have encountered in my travels...his was the most... human.

yeah. sorry. lame me all you want...i effing <3 star trek.

name: wonelove
text:
Noo!
it's going to hella kill him

name: unclesma
text: I am positive that is a direct quote of the movie.

name: peecat
text: I can never get enough of this floor vac thread. I really, really want one.

name: benthecartoon
text: Beef turned into Boomhauer for his first line, there.

name: shutup_shutup
text: I enjoy the contrast between this strip and this one .

name: allanpinkerton
text: I love how the Roombas don't even move at all so it is like they are just acting out the scene normally BUT STANDING ON ROOMBAS.

name: tonyhighwind
text: This is easily the best Roomba Cinema comic.  There isn't a single panel of this strip I don't laugh at every time I read it, I wish I could give this a seven.

name: fourganger
text: I can't believe that no one has picked up on the genius of this strip- they are on Roombas but have no need to move. The Roombas are entirely uneeded, yet there they are.

name: landowmpg
text: Note: Theodor uses the same pose whether acting Khan or Vader.
